text: Deepshikha Deshmukh also known as Deepshikha Bhagnani is an Indian film producer. She is the daughter of producer Vashu Bhagnani, and sister of the actor/producer Jackky Bhagnani. She is married to Dhiraj Deshmukh. ==Career== She debuted as a producer in 2016 with Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Randeep Hooda, starring Sarbjit. She then contribute to Madaari, starring Irrfan Khan. She partnered with Priyanka Chopra (as a producer) on Pooja Entertainment's first Punjabi film Sarvann. Her next project was Welcome to New York with Karan Johar, Sonakshi Sinha, and Diljit Dosanjh. She produced Dil Juunglee starring Tapsee Pannu and Jawaani Jaaneman with Saif Ali Khan and Alaya Furniturewala. Her future projects are Coolie No. 1 starring Varun Dhawan and Sara Ali Khan. Deepshikha is against animal cruelty and has been critical of the current minimum fines for that offense. She opposes the use of firecrackers during Diwali. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" |- !
